channel.title: Making Armor
channel.description: We, as a community, should start making more armor. 95% of our models are weapons or capes and that's great if we're making good stuff but we should start using that talent to make custom armor. If someone could please upload or find a good tutorial for making custom armor in meta, blender, 3DS, whatever... We could all get good and we'll expand.

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @_Troll-Scape ✆™☯Troll-Scape☯™✆
item.description:
@_Troll-Scape wrote:

[quote=“shrogg, post:7, topic:380325”]Meh, why armour? seriously, im getting sick of everything thats coming out of here…
IMO there should be more objects, armour is stupid because its either crap or crap because no-one here can model (excluding some people, who should know who they are by now)
objects can be anything, from funky crates to new trees, even go as far as making whole house “kit sets” where you can piece together different walls in a editor and create whole new towns with compleatly cool new ideas[/quote]is it me…
nah jokes I can’t model a pl8body for jackshit

Read full topic

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:26, topic:380325”][quote author=Lazyness link=topic=476157.msg3482303#msg3482303 date=1296273780]

nice shrogg

Agreed 100%. Someone has the creativity and work ethic to pull something off. Good job.
[/quote]Yeah, thats all you need. Seriously though, the best way to model something is to first sketch it out and go from there. Do what I do and create a wireframe on the sketch, draw the lines, and just model it by eyeballing it. The results turn out quite well.[/quote]
i did that for my Dragon War axe… the concept works great XD

Read full topic

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Lazyness, post:25, topic:380325”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=476157.msg3482285#msg3482285 date=1296271455]
nice shrogg
[/quote]

Agreed 100%. Someone has the creativity and work ethic to pull something off. Good job.[/quote]Yeah, thats all you need. Seriously though, the best way to model something is to first sketch it out and go from there. Do what I do and create a wireframe on the sketch, draw the lines, and just model it by eyeballing it. The results turn out quite well.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

You’re an idiot (._. ')

First of all, mironic isn’t provoking you in any way. If somehow, he is to you, then you obviously feel the need to accuse someone of this when things aren’t going your way in a discussion. And really, think about this. You want to import a character file (.mqo) into 3ds and build armor around that, right? Well if you can model, make armor on your own, the same way you would any other model. Then to import a model, export the .mqo character file to .3ds and import it into the 3DS program and go from there. Seriously, THAT IS ALL.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“Lazyness, post:20, topic:380325”][quote author=mironic link=topic=476157.msg3482255#msg3482255 date=1296269454]
im not trolling?

im saying… No one will model armors because they have no imagination… im not looking for a reaction, im looking for you to not be stupid… and what you just said there… up’d your stupidity.
Good day.
[/quote]

Who are you to say that someone else has no imagination? You can see the imagination flowing through the models that have been made. Your posts are completely invalid.

[quote author=rip4d link=topic=476157.msg3482266#msg3482266 date=1296270010]http://www.lmgtfy.com/?q=3ds+tutorial

I don’t think it gets much easier than this. Learn to do stuff yourself and not make others do it for you. Just learn to model in 3ds and make armor from there. Really, its not too hard, I could do it in meta while I’ve NEVER made any type of armor before.

PS. You’re the fool, since mironic isn’t trolling, hurr durr.
[/quote]

Hmm… That link helped a lot because I said “searching for a guide on how to make armor”. Makes sense because your link didn’t help me at all with making armors for rsps. I’m talking about making or looking up guides that give step by step instructions on how to make custom armors like importing a character model, working around the model and modifying textures.

I love how you say mironic isn’t trolling. Whether it be trolling or flaming or whatever you want to call it, it’s all the same to me. To be honest from the responses I’ve gotten from this thread and the things that I’ve seen from other threads, I’d much rather not waste my time trying to get through to you half-wit flamers who think this forum is your hood.

If you want to say something, back it up with information and valid points.[/quote]
You know what. i cant even say anything anymore you just passed the stupidity of no return.

Good day.
leaves Topic
REQUEST LOCK!

Read full topic

Good day.[/quote]

[quote=“rip4d, post:19, topic:380325”]http://www.lmgtfy.com/?q=3ds+tutorial

I don’t think it gets much easier than this. Learn to do stuff yourself and not make others do it for you. Just learn to model in 3ds and make armor from there. Really, its not too hard, I could do it in meta while I’ve NEVER made any type of armor before.

PS. You’re the fool, since mironic isn’t trolling, hurr durr.[/quote]

Hmm… That link helped a lot because I said “searching for a guide on how to make armor”. Makes sense because your link didn’t help me at all with making armors for rsps. I’m talking about making or looking up guides that give step by step instructions on how to make custom armors like importing a character model, working around the model and modifying textures.

I love how you say mironic isn’t trolling. Whether it be trolling or flaming or whatever you want to call it, it’s all the same to me. To be honest from the responses I’ve gotten from this thread and the things that I’ve seen from other threads, I’d much rather not waste my time trying to get through to you half-wit flamers who think this forum is your hood.

If you want to say something, back it up with information and valid points.

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote author=Lazyness link=topic=476157.msg3482249#msg3482249 date=1296268797]

[quote=“mironic, post:11, topic:380325”]WRONG!
I would like to see you make an armor with good imagination added to it. and im not talking about logo designs on it.

most armor designs have already been taken and therefor no imagination is needed to make armors.

Weapons on the other hand… are filled with new imagination and designs every time i come back here.

Everyone but you knows what i mean

and @shrogg
i am a object modeler XD…

i have 3 objects made O-o remember my Sun and moon gate?
and that snowman i made for x-mas[/quote]

You trying to get somewhere with me? You want some sort of reaction from me? I’m not getting mad over your trolling. In fact, I chuckle because it makes you look like a fool.

rip4d:

I call it Google, hurr durr.

Mmm yeah. How about you find the right link because I just googled multiple times and didn’t find anything relevant.[/quote]http://www.lmgtfy.com/?q=3ds+tutorial

I don’t think it gets much easier than this. Learn to do stuff yourself and not make others do it for you. Just learn to model in 3ds and make armor from there. Really, its not too hard, I could do it in meta while I’ve NEVER made any type of armor before.

PS. You’re the fool, since mironic isn’t trolling, hurr durr.

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Lazyness:

We, as a community, should start making more armor. 95% of our models are weapons or capes and that’s great if we’re making good stuff but we should start using that talent to make custom armor. If someone could please upload or find a good tutorial for making custom armor in meta, blender, 3DS, whatever… We could all get good and we’ll expand.

I made an armor set once. Then it came to animating it and I said “Fuck that”. Disappointed a decent amount of people when i never released it. Long story short: Fuck custom animating. Easy as it is, its not enjoyable. Of course this is coming from the views of someone who does not own nor play any RSPS and has a dislike for the manual animating of anything RSPS related.

Read full topic

If someone could please upload or find a good tutorial for making custom armor in meta, blender, 3DS, whatever… We could all get good and we’ll expand.[/quote]I call it Google, hurr durr.

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

shrogg:

yeah, well ive been trying to get people to model objects, but it dont happen

Will only happen if you get a movement going, post good models of objects you’ve made and/or post tutorials on how to do it. I’d be up for making objects.

item.title: Making Armor
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“Lazyness, post:9, topic:380325”][quote author=mironic link=topic=476157.msg3482225#msg3482225 date=1296267465]
You come into OUR community and Tell us What to do… Lol.

its not that we dont know how to make armors its just that its unfun and un creative…

armors are really a basic shape… for all of them… weapons can be whatever your imagination can put to geather with a stander’d hilt. like i do helmets gloves boots objects npc’s and weapons becuase there fun

plate armor and legs are just boring so… Screw you ima stick to my plans.
[/quote]

You shouldn’t have wasted your time posting. You post doesn’t make sense. Armors can be just as creative as weapons, you just have to have the imagination to make good armors.

Meh, why armour? seriously, im getting sick of everything thats coming out of here…
IMO there should be more objects, armour is stupid because its either crap or crap because no-one here can model (excluding some people, who should know who they are by now)
objects can be anything, from funky crates to new trees, even go as far as making whole house “kit sets” where you can piece together different walls in a editor and create whole new towns with compleatly cool new ideas

I think one of the only reasons why armors are crap is because no one has anything to work off of. There aren’t any tutorials here so how would someone go about making armor sets if they don’t know what to do?

Your object modelling idea is interesting. Sounds good to me.[/quote]
WRONG!
I would like to see you make an armor with good imagination added to it. and im not talking about logo designs on it.

most armor designs have already been taken and therefor no imagination is needed to make armors.

Weapons on the other hand… are filled with new imagination and designs every time i come back here.

Everyone but you knows what i mean

and @shrogg
i am a object modeler XD…

i have 3 objects made O-o remember my Sun and moon gate?
and that snowman i made for x-mas

Read full topic
